;;荷兰公民 Joran van der Sloot，在承认杀害了一名 21 岁秘鲁人后正在秘鲁服 28 年徒刑一名女子被护送到机场，准备被引渡到美国，面临对娜塔莉·霍洛威 (Natalee Holloway) 家人进行敲诈勒索和电汇欺诈的指控，该案与他涉嫌参与 2005 年阿鲁巴岛利马的娜塔莉·霍洛威 (Natalee Holloway) 失踪事件有关秘鲁，2023 年 6 月 8 日。路透社/Sebastian Castaneda/档案照片;
;

;2005 年阿拉巴马州青少年娜塔莉·霍洛威 (Natalee Holloway) 死亡的主要嫌疑人乔兰·范德斯洛特 (Joran van der Sloot) 承认在海滩上杀害了她周三，他在加勒比海的阿鲁巴岛上承认了敲诈勒索受害者母亲的罪名。

;

;6 月，36 岁的范德斯洛特暂时;从秘鲁监狱引渡到阿拉巴马州;，面临美国的两项勒索和电汇欺诈指控。自 2012 年以来，他因在秘鲁首都利马谋杀另一名妇女而被判 28 年徒刑，正在服刑。

;

;他最初;在阿拉巴马州伯明翰联邦法院对他密谋让霍洛威的母亲贝丝·霍洛威在 2010 年向他支付 25 万美元的指控表示无罪;范德斯洛特进入牢房后，贝丝·霍洛威 (Beth Holloway) 在法庭上说道：“你是一名杀手，我希望你记住，每次牢房门关上时，你都会知道这一点。”据 NBC 新闻报道，范德斯洛特在认罪并放弃上诉权时向霍洛威家人道歉，并表示自谋杀案发生以来他已皈依基督教。

;

;美国地区法官安娜·马纳斯科 (Anna Manasco) 判处他 20 年监禁，与在秘鲁的刑期同时服刑，随后在监督下释放三年。

;

;预计他很快将被送回秘鲁在那里完成他的刑期，如果他被假释或释放，则被命令返回美国。

;

;Holloway，一名来自伯明翰郊区的 18 岁青少年，于 2005 年高中毕业时失踪前往加勒比海的阿鲁巴岛（荷兰领土）。

;

;目击者称，她最后一次被看到是在失踪当晚，与范德斯洛特一起乘车离开酒吧。虽然她的遗体从未被发现，但阿拉巴马州的一名法官于 2012 年宣布她合法死亡。

;

;本月早些时候，作为敲诈勒索和电信欺诈指控认罪协议的一部分，范德斯洛特向美国调查人员承认，他霍洛威在酒店附近的海滩上多次拒绝了霍洛威的性侵犯，随后她杀死了霍洛威。在她用膝盖顶住他的胯部后，他说他踢了她的脸，将她打昏，然后捡起了附近的一块“巨大的煤渣块”。

;

;“我用它彻底砸碎了她的头， ”根据提交给法庭的一份笔录，他告诉调查人员。他说，然后他把她的尸体扔进海里，然后步行回家。

;

;美国检察官普里姆·埃斯卡洛纳 (Prim Escalona) 在听证会后对记者表示：“今天标志着 18 年来对娜塔莉·霍洛威 (Natalee Holloway) 遭遇的疑惑的结束。”< /p>;

;阿鲁巴的荷兰当局因涉嫌谋杀两次逮捕了范德斯洛特，但最终因缺乏证据而释放了他。

;

;霍洛威的家人与联邦调查局合作开展诱捕行动，给其中一部分电报2010 年，范德斯洛特向范德斯洛特支付了所要求的 25,100 美元，但随后他提供了有关霍洛威遗体埋葬地点的虚假信息。

;

;在判刑时，马纳斯科法官还命令范德斯洛特向贝丝·霍洛威支付 25,100 美元听证会结束后，贝丝·霍洛威表示正义已经得到伸张。

;

;“范德斯洛特的认罪意味着我们终于结束了永无休止的噩梦。”她告诉记者。 “就我而言，娜塔莉的案子已经结案了。一切都结束了。”

;

;2012 年，范德斯洛特在秘鲁承认殴打、勒死和窒息 21 岁的斯蒂芬妮·弗洛雷斯 (Stephany Flores)，后被定罪。 2010 年 5 月，秘鲁商科学生，20 岁。

;美国两党议员小组敦促拜登政府迅速打击哈马斯及其武装分子使用加密货币的行为巴勒斯坦激进组织本月早些时候在以色列发动致命袭击后，美国政府对其附属机构进行了调查。

;

;周二，以参议员伊丽莎白·沃伦 (Elizabeth Warren)、罗杰·马歇尔 (Roger Marshall) 和众议员肖恩·卡斯滕 (Sean Casten) 为首的 105 名议员致美国财政部和白宫的一封信，对哈马斯和一个名为巴勒斯坦伊斯兰圣战组织的附属组织正在使用数字资产为其行动提供资金并逃避美国制裁表示“严重关切”。

;

;“国会和本届政府必须采取强有力的行动，彻底解决加密货币非法行为信中说：“在风险被用来资助另一场悲剧之前，先对其进行融资。” -website-2023-10-18/">;发布制裁;，旨在扰乱哈马斯的资金来源，特别指出所谓的“哈马斯秘密投资组合”、与伊朗和加沙加密货币有关的金融服务商

;

;“我们将继续采取一切必要措施，阻止哈马斯恐怖分子筹集和使用资金实施暴行和恐吓以色列人民的能力，”财政部长珍妮特·耶伦在一份声明中表示。

;

;以色列警方于 10 月 10 日表示，;冻结了多个用于为哈马斯募捐的加密账户。路透社 5 月份报道称，以色列扣押了;大约 190 个自 2021 年以来，加密货币交易所币安的加密货币账户;，其中有数十个据称是与哈马斯有关联的巴勒斯坦公司拥有的。

;

;币安表示，该交易所一直在“与国际反恐机构密切合作”，以打击恐怖主义。

;

;从一开始，加密货币社区就将数字资产吹捧为匿名交易的工具，一系列针对欺诈、洗钱和未注册代币发行的联邦执法行动使该行业成为人们关注的焦点。

;

;哈马斯利用全球融资网络来汇集慈善机构和友好国家的支持，包括使用加密货币，;路透社周一报道;。

;

;以色列当局从哈马斯相关地址中查获了“数千万美元”的加密货币据区块链研究人员 TRM Labs 称，近年来，立法者要求拜登政府提供对哈马斯控制钱包中剩余加密资产价值的估计，哈马斯的行动有多少是通过加密货币资助的，以及有关协助哈马斯和其他激进组织发送加密货币的参与者的任何信息。

;美国正在考虑的对委内瑞拉石油出口制裁的豁免不应导致欧佩克原油产量大幅激增专家表示，而不是从目前的主要目的地中国转移石油。

;

;美国总统乔·拜登政府计划提供一些;几乎立即广泛放松对委内瑞拉石油和天然气行业的能源相关制裁; ，作为对委内瑞拉政府与该国反对派之间达成的 2024 年总统选举保障协议的回应。

;

;该协议于周二在巴巴多斯签署，规定了 ;选举的一些条款;，但不包括解除公职禁令关键反对派人物或释放政治犯。

;

;同一天，特立尼达和多巴哥宣布美国授权;许可证修正案;为与委内瑞拉的联合天然气项目扫清了道路。

;

;委内瑞拉平均每天生产 780,000 桶今年到目前为止，原油产量（桶/日）高于 2022 年的 71.6 万桶/日，但距离 2024 年 170 万桶/日的官方目标仍相距甚远。

;

;拜登政府一直在寻找增加全球原油流量的方法。石油以缓解因俄罗斯制裁和欧佩克+减产而造成的高油价。专家表示，如果投资不大幅增加，委内瑞拉的出口不太可能抵消这些削减。

;

;二十年来的管理不善和投资不足，加上美国自 2019 年以来的石油制裁，预计将阻碍国营 PDVSA 的发展。能够迅速重返现金支付的石油市场并以公平的价格提供原油。

;

;华盛顿迄今为止作为其制裁宽松战略的一部分授予的最重要的石油许可证是雪佛龙公司< a href="https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/CVX.N" target="_blank">;(CVX.N); 11 月。该公司与PDVSA的合资产量几乎翻了一番，并恢复了对委内瑞拉前主要市场美国的出口。

;

;然而，占该国总产量约20%的雪佛龙合资企业却无力扭亏为盈。民族工业。 PDVSA 继续努力筹集资金、进口钻井平台、修复炼油厂、推进项目并确保相关合作伙伴关系。

;

;委内瑞拉的原油产量仍仅为美国金融和石油制裁开始之前平均每天 240 万桶的一小部分。 2017 年实施的。根据贝克休斯的数据，该国只有一台活跃的钻机，而 2014 年有 80 多个。

;

;委内瑞拉需要一长串的项目才能再次成为相关的石油出口国向分析师提供的资金包括：数十个钻井平台、数十亿美元的炼油厂基础设施更换、流动站和原油升级设施以及可靠的电力供应。

;

;欧佩克盟友已将委内瑞拉排除在配额之外，并给予该国空间泵更多。但专家预测，随着华盛顿一一授权合资伙伴扩大业务和出口，复苏之路将十分缓慢。

;

;委内瑞拉石油产量预计未来将增长 17 万至 20 万桶/日如果雪佛龙、埃尼;(ENI.MI);和雷普索尔;(REP.MC); 坚持去年以来美国批准的扩张计划，如果 Maurel &舞会;(MAUP.PA);;获得了类似的许可;，可以通过出口委内瑞拉原油来偿还债务。

;

;如果美国授权与特立尼达联合海上项目的谈判取得进展，委内瑞拉也可能开始天然气出口。

;

;美国的授权可能为向美国、欧洲和加勒比海地区的更多出口扫清道路，委内瑞拉正在分析师表示，预计将把目前大部分石油转移到中国。

;

;委内瑞拉直接和通过转运中心对中国的出口量已从今年迄今为止的 477,000 桶/日降至 437,000 桶/日。根据船舶监测数据，到 2022 年石油产量将达到 2022 年。

;

;如果委内瑞拉和中国达成协议，恢复债务偿还并扩大联合石油项目，可能会在两年内额外增加 10 万桶/日的产量， Monaldi 补充道，有可能再次扩大对该目的地的出口。

;

;但由于制裁放松的范围有限，且同时不允许新的投资，因此很难预测 2019 年总产量将超过 110 万桶/日。他说，未来几年。

;以色列誓言要通过对加沙地带的无情攻击消灭哈马斯，但目前看不到明显的结局，即使在战场上取得胜利，也没有如何管理饱受蹂躏的巴勒斯坦飞地的明确计划。

;

;代号为“铁剑行动”的军事行动将是无与伦比的猛烈，与以色列实施的任何行动都不同据八名了解冲突情况的地区和西方官员透露，由于此事敏感，他们拒绝透露姓名。

;

;以色列已调集了创纪录的 360,000 名士兵;预备役军人;并跟随哈马斯不停地轰炸这个小小的飞地10 月 7 日;袭击;以色列南部，造成约 1,400 人死亡，其中大部分是平民。

;

;三名熟悉美国和中东领导人之间讨论的地区官员表示，以色列的当前战略是摧毁加沙的基础设施，甚至不惜造成大量平民伤亡，将飞地的人民推向埃及边境，并通过炸毁哈马斯为开展行动而建造的迷宫般的地下隧道来追击哈马斯。

;

;以色列官员表示，他们对哈马斯没有明确的想法不过，战后的未来可能会是什么样子。

;

;美国总统乔·拜登的一些助手担心，虽然以色列可能会制定一项有效计划，对哈马斯造成持久损害，但它尚未制定退出方案华盛顿一位知情人士称，这是一项战略。

;

;美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯和国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀上周访问以色列，强调需要重点关注加沙战后计划消息人士补充道。

;

;阿拉伯官员还感到震惊的是，以色列尚未为这片飞地的未来制定明确的计划。该飞地自 2006 年以来一直由哈马斯统治，拥有 230 万人口。

;

;“以色列对加沙的争夺还没有结束。他们的策略是投下数千枚炸弹，摧毁一切，然后进去，但然后呢？他们没有第二天的退出战略，”一位地区安全消息人士表示。

;

;以色列的入侵尚未开始，但加沙当局表示，空袭已造成 3,500 名巴勒斯坦人死亡，约占三分之一其中有儿童 - 死亡人数比哈马斯和以色列之前的任何冲突都要多。

;

;拜登，在;周三访问以色列;，告诉以色列人需要为哈马斯伸张正义，不过他警告说，在纽约 9/11 袭击之后，美国犯了错误。

;

;他说，“绝大多数巴勒斯坦人不是哈马斯”。“哈马斯不代表巴勒斯坦人民。”

;

;中东问题专家亚伦·戴维·米勒卡内基国际和平基金会表示，拜登的访问将使他有机会敦促以色列领导人本杰明·内塔尼亚胡在入侵之前考虑使用武力的比例以及对加沙的长期计划等问题。

;

;包括内塔尼亚胡在内的以色列官员表示，他们将;擦除; 哈马斯对此次袭击进行报复，这是以色列 75 年历史上最致命的一次袭击。

;

;接下来发生的事情尚不明确。

;

;“我们当然在想以色列国家安全委员会主任查奇·哈内格比周二对记者表示：“这涉及评估，包括国家安全委员会、军方和其他方面对最终局势的评估。” “我们不确定这会是什么。”

;

;“但我们所知道的是不会有什么，”他说，指的是以色列宣称的消灭哈马斯的目标。

;

; >;

;这可能说起来容易做起来难。

;

;“这是一个地下城市的隧道，使越共的隧道看起来像儿戏，”第一个地区消息来源说，指的是共产党游击队，在越南反抗美军。 “他们不会用坦克和火力结束哈马斯。”

;

;两名地区军事专家告诉路透社，哈马斯的武装派别卡萨姆旅已经动员起来进行入侵，建立了反政府武装。 -用于伏击部队的坦克地雷和诱杀爆炸装置。

;

;以色列即将发动的攻势将比过去的加沙行动规模大得多，以色列官员此前将其称为“割草”，削弱了哈马斯的军队以色列曾在 2008 年 9 月、2012 年和 2014 年与哈马斯发生过三场冲突，并在其中两次战役中发动了有限的土地入侵，但与今天不同的是，以色列领导人从未发誓一劳永逸地摧毁哈马斯。

;

;在这三场对抗中，有近 4,000 名巴勒斯坦人和不到 100 名以色列人死亡。

;

;

;The US Environmental Protection Agency on Wednesday issued a final determination declaring that emissions from aircraft that use leaded fuel pose a danger to public health, following years of study.

;

;Commercial aircraft use jet fuel, which does not contain lead. Aircraft that do use leaded fuel are typically small piston-engine planes that carry two-10 passengers and are around 45 to 47 years old.

;

;"The science is clear: exposure to lead can cause irreversible and life-long health effects in children,” EPA Administrator Michael Regan said in a statement announcing that the agency was finalizing a decision ;proposed in October 2022;.

;

;Children's exposure to lead can cause irreversible and life-long health effects, the EPA said.

;

;Emissions from the 190,000 US privately owned airplanes operating on leaded fuel account for about 70% of the lead entering the atmosphere, according to prior US government estimates.

;

;The EPA said it and the Federal Aviation Administration have begun "work to consider regulatory options to address lead emissions from aircraft engines."

;

;The EPA's review of lead emissions from aircraft dates to 2006, when it received a petition asking for regulation of lead emissions from privately owned airplanes. The agency opened a proceeding in 2010, and in 2015 said it planned to issue a final endangerment finding in 2018.

;

;While levels of airborne lead in the United States have declined 99% since 1980, piston-engine aircraft are the largest remaining source of lead emissions into the air.

;

;The FAA in 2022 announced a new initiative outlining how to safely eliminate the use of leaded aviation fuel by the end of 2030 without adversely affecting the existing piston-engine fleet.

;

;Reuters ;first reported in January 2022 ;that the EPA was again reviewing whether emissions from piston-engine aircraft operating on leaded fuel contribute pose a danger to public health.

;

;President Joe Biden's nominee for ambassador to Israel, former Treasury Secretary Jack Lew, was expected ultimately to win US Senate confirmation, despite opposition from Republicans at his confirmation hearing on Wednesday tied to his past involvement in negotiations with Iran.

;

;Biden's fellow Democrats have been rushing to confirm Lew quickly, saying they want to offer Israel ;staunch support; in the aftermath of the Oct. 7 attack on Israeli villages and military bases by Gaza-based Palestinian Hamas gunmen who killed 1,400 people and took about 200 hostages.

;

;Washington has not had an ambassador to Israel since July, when Tom Nides left the post. Rising concern over the conflict between Israel and Hamas has drawn attention to the vacancy. Lew was nominated in September.

;

;Republicans at the Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing questioned Lew about a 2015 Iran nuclear deal sealed during his time in former Democratic President Barack Obama's cabinet.

;

;The hearing took place as ;Biden visited Israel.;

;

;Democrats stressed the important of getting Lew in place quickly, including so he could help free Americans believed to be among the Hamas hostages but Republican opposition could make that difficult.

;

;"I am committed to getting you in place as soon as possible," said the committee chairman, Democratic Senator Ben Cardin. He scheduled a business meeting for next week for a committee vote on the nomination.

;

;Security was heightened around the US Capitol complex, as it has been repeatedly since Oct. 7. The hearing was interrupted three times by shouting protesters.

;

;Lew can be confirmed even if Republicans unite against him. Biden's fellow Democrats hold a slim majority in the committee and full Senate.

;

;Senator Jim Risch, the committee's top Republican, said he agreed Israel needed an ambassador quickly, but it must be the right person. He said he had "reservations" about Lew, citing the nuclear agreement and accusing the former Treasury secretary of "backhanded support" for Iran.

;

;Republicans - and some Democrats - objected to the international nuclear pact, in which Iran agreed to halt its nuclear program in exchange for sanctions relief. Republican former President Donald Trump, who took office in 2017, pulled Washington out of the pact in 2018.

;

;Lew stressed repeatedly his intention to be tough on Iran, rejecting accusations he had acted inappropriately. "I want to be clear: Iran is a threat to regional stability and to Israel's existence. If confirmed, I will uphold President Biden's commitment to deny Iran a nuclear weapon and warning to anyone in the region to anyone who's thinking of taking advantage of the current crisis: Don't," he said.

;

;He said he did not believe the Biden administration should seek to reopen the nuclear pact. "I believe deeply that an agreement not to have nuclear weapons would be a good thing but this is not the moment," he said.

;

;Lew said the violence should not derail talks between Israel, Saudi Arabia and the United States seeking to normalize relations between Israel and Saudi Arabia.

;

;The shock Oct. 7 attack prompted fierce Israeli retaliation against the Hamas-ruled Gaza Strip. Health authorities in Gaza said at least 3,000 people had been killed in Israel's bombardment, even before hundreds of ;Palestinians perished; on Tuesday in a blast at a Gaza hospital.

;

;Some ;Republicans blamed; Biden's Democratic administration's dealings with Iran, especially the release of $6 billion of Iranian assets in a prisoner swap deal, for the assault by Hamas. Administration officials say Iran has not had access to that money and could only use it for humanitarian purposes approved by the United States.

;

;A budget expert, Lew served as chief of staff for Obama before being confirmed as Treasury secretary in February 2013 by 71-26 in the 100-member Senate, with support from both Republicans and Democrats.

;

;Noting that he is an observant Jew, Lew expressed grief about Oct. 7. "I've never seen in my lifetime human beings treat other human beings face to face, eyeball to eyeball, the way Jews were slaughtered because they were Jews." he said.

;;Military vehicles of US soldiers are seen at the al-Asad air base in Anbar province, Iraq, January 13, 2020. REUTERS/John Davison/File Photo;
;

;The US military thwarted an attack in Iraq early on Wednesday, intercepting two drones before they could strike, two US officials said after the first such attack on US forces in Iraq in more than a year.

;

;The officials, who spoke to Reuters on condition of anonymity, declined to say who was suspected of the attack on the al-Asad air base. Washington is on heightened alert for activity by Iran-backed groups as regional tensions soar during the Israel-Hamas war.

;

;Later on Wednesday another drone attack targeting the al-Harir air base, which houses US forces in the northern Iraqi city of Erbil, was also foiled, an Iraqi security official and a Western diplomat said.

;

;The Iraqi semi-autonomous Kurdistan region's security agency, Kurdistan Counter Terrorism, said an armed drone fell in a desert area near the village of Batas in Harir district at 12:18 pm Iraq time. It did not elaborate.

;

;A little known group called Tashkil al-Waritheen, or the Inheritor, claimed responsibility for the attack on al-Harir.

;

;Last week, ;Iraqi armed groups; aligned with Iran threatened to target US interests with missiles and drones if Washington intervened to support Israel's war with Hamas in Gaza.

;

;The Pentagon has rushed air defenses and munitions to Israel, America's closest ally in the Middle East, but US forces have not joined the fighting.

;

;The one-way attack drones were intercepted as they attempted to strike Iraq's al Asad air base, which also hosts American troops, the US officials said.

;

;The attack came hours after an explosion at a ;Gaza hospital; killed hundreds of Palestinians, raising the stakes for US President Joe Biden as he arrived in Israel on Wednesday to signal support for its war against Hamas.

;

;Palestinian officials said the hospital was hit by an Israeli air strike. Israel denied this, blaming the blast at Al-Ahli al-Arabi hospital on a failed rocket launch by the Palestinian Islamic Jihad group, which denied responsibility.

;

;The Palestinian Authority's health minister accused Israel of causing a "massacre".

;

;In Iraq, tension over the war in Gaza had already been high. Its top Shi'ite Muslim cleric, Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani, last week condemned Israel and called on the world to stand up to the "terrible brutality" in besieged Gaza.

;

;Leaders of Iraqi armed groups blamed Israel for the attack on the hospital. Some condemned the US for supporting Israel.

;

;Kataib Hezbollah, a powerful armed faction with close ties to Iran, accused the United States of supporting Israel in "killing innocent people" and said it should leave Iraq.

;

;"These evil people must leave the country, otherwise they will taste the fire of hell in this world before the afterlife," the group said in a statement late on Tuesday.

;

;Iraqi politician Hadi Al-Amiri, leader of the political and military Badr Organisation which is close to Iran, also blamed Israel for the attack on the hospital and described it as "the massacre of the era, which can only be classified as a war crime". Amiri condemned the US and Western countries for supporting Israel.

;

;We “will not hesitate to consider America and the West as partners in this hideous massacre”, he said in a statement on Tuesday night. Last week he threatened to target US interests if Washington intervened to support Israel.

;

;The United States has 2,500 troops in Iraq, and 900 more in neighbouring Syria, on a mission to advise and assist local forces in combating Islamic State, which in 2014 seized swathes of territory in both countries.

;

;In past years, Iranian-backed militias in Iraq regularly targeted US forces in Iraq and the US embassy in Baghdad with rockets. Such attacks have abated under a truce in place since last year, and Iraq has had a period of relative calm.

;

;US officials have accused Kataib Hezbollah of previous attacks on US interests. The group has denied the claims.

;

;Dozens of members of the Popular Mobilisation Forces (PMF), the Iraqi state paramilitary organisation that contains many Iran-backed factions, took to the streets on Tuesday to condemn the Gaza hospital attack.

;

;Demonstrators chanted anti-US and anti-Israeli slogans and said they wanted to storm the US embassy for its support of Israel.

;

;A Reuters witness said some protesters tried to cross the bridge that leads to the fortified Green Zone - home to the US embassy and other missions in Baghdad - but security forces blocked them.

;

;The United States issued new sanctions Wednesday on people and companies based in Iran, Hong Kong, China and Venezuela for enabling Iran's ;ballistic missile and drone programs;, the Treasury Department said.

;

;The sanctions target those who have supported the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) and the defense ministry in the production and proliferation of the missiles and drones, Treasury said in ;a statement;.

;

;They include 11 individuals, eight companies and one vessel were targeted, it said.

;

;"Iran's reckless choice to continue its proliferation of destructive UAVs and other weapons prolongs numerous conflicts in regions around the world," said Brian Nelson, undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Intelligence.

;

;The companies include the Iran-based Fanavaran Sanat Ertebatat Co, which produces jam-resistant guidance systems, and two directors, Armin Ghorsi Anbaran and Hossein Hemsi, Treasury said.

;

;Saberin Kish Company, an Iran-based, IRGC-owned company, brought components used to repair lawful intercept and technical equipment, it said, while Iran-based agent Alireza Matinkia facilitated the shipment of Japan- and US-origin, dual-use electronic components from Hong Kong to Iran, it said.

;

;Treasury said China-based Lin Jinghe, also known as Gary Lam, "procured Japanese-, Swiss-, Taiwanese-, and UK-origin, dual-use circulators, amplifiers, inductors, and other electronic components for Matinkia using his Hong Kong-based company Nanxigu Technology Co., Limited." Hong Kong-based Dali RF Technology Co. Limited was cited for receiving transfers related to Lin Jinghe's procurement, it said.

;

;Iran-based electronics companies Electro Optic Sairan Industries Co. and Sarmad Electronic Sepahan Company also were sanctioned, it said.

;

;Treasury also cited other people involved in Iranian weapons proliferation networks led by Emily Liu and Rayan Roshd Afzar Company, including China-based Yongxin Li and Yiu Wa Yung of Hong Kong, it said.

;

;The US sanctions also target exports of unmanned aerial vehicles to Venezuela. Treasury imposed sanctions on Iranian defense minister Mohammad-Reza Ashtiani for helping to supply the drones and other weapons to Caracas, and Iran's defense attache in Caracas, Jaber Reihani.

;

;Iran-based QAI and its managing director Ghasem Damavandian were engaged with senior Venezuelan officials on supplying drones and other aircraft, Treasury said.

;

;The cargo vessel Parnia was sanctioned for transporting several Iranian Peykaap III fast attack missile patrol boats to Venezuela, it said.
